title: P2F
text:
P2F (), also known as P2F model or P2F finance, is a <a href="concept">concept</a> of <a href="Internet%20finance">Internet finance</a> with full name of person-to-financial institution products. The term refers to the mode in which <a href="individual">individual</a>s connect with the products of <a href="financial%20institution">financial institution</a>s and quasi-financial institutions through the <a href="Internet">Internet</a>.
In the term "P2F", "P" stands for "peer", and "F" stands for "financial institution" or "<a href="financial%20asset">financial asset</a>". P2F is gradually derived from the P2P model. The representatives of P2F are Beevault and Yu'ebao (余额宝). 
Definition.
P2F is a <a href="terminology">term</a> of "Internet finance", which was coined in 2012 by Ping Xie and Chuanwei Zou. P2F is a model in which individuals connect with the products of the <a href="financial%20institution">financial institution</a> and quasi-financial institution via the Internet.
P2F is an upgraded version of P2P. Compared with P2P, financing objects of P2F are financial institutions and quasi-financial institution.
